result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlynn R Helt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1,000 fine plus costs. Paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orlynn R Helt

Defendant Orlynn R Helt in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Count 1 to misdemeanor. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 9, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Henry Reid Schultz appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews purpose of hearing, letters from State/Defense. Court make statement, thinks deference should be given to State in how they wish to proceed, will have 14-CF-41 case go first. Discussion regarding scheduling/motions/State's use immunity motion.
from Atty Schultz advising of agreement with State's request to schedule Cefalu trial prior to Helt
of Motion hearing held 9/29/14
from State presenting argument regarding order of trials

Defendant Orlynn R Helt appeared by phone. Attorney Henry Reid Schultz appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews State's motion to join, brief by Defense in opposition. Atty Schultz believes risk is significant that one Defendant will not receive a fair trial due to antagonistic defense. Atty Korb responds. Atty Schultz responds. Atty Mitz responds. Court makes statement, thinks it would be cleaner to do 2 trials, denies motion, will set each case for trial. Atty Korb will advise JA which should be set first. Atty Mitz would prefer to go second. Atty Korb's first instinct was to have Mr. Cefalu go first. Atty Schultz is not prepared to argue either way. Atty Korb to submit letter to Court regarding which case should be set first. Counsel will be given time to respond. Court hopes to be able to do scheduling by end of week. Court will set for 2 days trial and pre-trial. Motions due 3 weeks before pre-trial. Atty Korb discusses possibility of immunity for Mr. Helt's testimony. Atty Schultz responds. Atty Korb's letter due by 10/3, responses due by 10/8.  Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty plea. Discussion regarding joinder. Defense would like to respond in writing. Court will allow Defense to appear by phone, Defendant can appear by phone. Bond continues as is. Motions to be filed by 9/1 or if late discovery, Defense can request extension.
by State

Defendant Orlynn R Helt in court with attorney Henry R Schultz.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense presents argument in support of motion to dismiss. State presents argument. Court makes statement, denies motion.  Testimony taken. Defense makes argument. State makes argument. Defense presents argument. Court finds probable cause, binds Defendant over for trial.
Preliminary hearing on June 19, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Henry R Schultz in court.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of Motions filed by himself and State, would like to take up joinder motion later. State advises that joinder has been agreed to for prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 02:30 pm. Bond continues as is.

No contact direct or indirect Door/Kewaunee Salmon Tournament.  Not to discuss case with MC.

Defendant Orlynn R Helt in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Bond set.  Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim.  Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Parties can appear by phone for next hearing. Discussion regarding fingerprinting.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Phone call from Attorney Henry Schultz indicating he will be representing Mr. Helt.  He is unavailable in the morning.  Changed the hearing time to 3 p.m. to accommodate Attorney Schultz's schedule.
